page.title: 10TYPICAL DAY FOR THE TEACHER
page.content: { I live fairly close to school, so I do not have to get up too early; usually at 7.30. I arrive in school at 8.25 and start by going to my class then to the staff-room. There are usually some children already in class, since they fetch the computer, and they start to work immediately. I start properly at 8.55, when the majority of the children come into school. The children have each planned their work (either as pairs or groups) so they start their work immediately. I am on hand to discuss and offer any suggestions I might think neccessary. My day is therefore spent talking to the children and helping or ensuring that their needs are met. I spent my free time running clubs of various sorts, and preparing work. I mark work with the children.
